summary.long: 1 Timothy is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus by command of God our Saviour and of Christ Jesus our hope,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To Timothy, my true child in the faith:
Grace, mercy, and peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As I urged you when I was going to Macedonia, remain at Ephesus so that you may charge certain persons not to teach any different doctrine,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nor to devote themselves to myths and endless genealogies, which promote speculations rather than the stewardship from God that is by faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The aim of our charge is love that issues from a pure heart and a good conscience and a sincere faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Certain persons, by swerving from these, have wandered away into vain discussion,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: desiring to be teachers of the law, without understanding either what they are saying or the things about which they make confident assertions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now we know that the law is good, if one uses it lawfully,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: understanding this, that the law is not laid down for the just but for the lawless and disobedient, for the ungodly and sinners, for the unholy and profane, for those who strike their fathers and mothers, for murderers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the sexually immoral, men who practise homosexuality, enslavers, liars, perjurers, and whatever else is contrary to sound doctrine,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in accordance with the gospel of the glory of the blessed God with which I have been entrusted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I thank him who has given me strength, Christ Jesus our Lord, because he judged me faithful, appointing me to his service,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: though formerly I was a blasphemer, persecutor, and insolent opponent. But I received mercy because I had acted ignorantly in unbelief,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the grace of our Lord overflowed for me with the faith and love that are in Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The saying is trustworthy and deserving of full acceptance, that Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners, of whom I am the foremost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I received mercy for this reason, that in me, as the foremost, Jesus Christ might display his perfect patience as an example to those who were to believe in him for eternal life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the King of ages, immortal, invisible, the only God, be honour and glory for ever and ever. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This charge I entrust to you, Timothy, my child, in accordance with the prophecies previously made about you, that by them you may wage the good warfare,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: holding faith and a good conscience. By rejecting this, some have made shipwreck of their faith,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: among whom are Hymenaeus and Alexander, whom I have handed over to Satan that they may learn not to blaspheme.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: First of all, then, I urge that supplications, prayers, intercessions, and thanksgivings be made for all people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for kings and all who are in high positions, that we may lead a peaceful and quiet life, godly and dignified in every way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is good, and it is pleasing in the sight of God our Saviour,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who desires all people to be saved and to come to the knowledge of the truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there is one God, and there is one mediator between God and men, the man Christ Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who gave himself as a ransom for all, which is the testimony given at the proper time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this I was appointed a preacher and an apostle (I am telling the truth, I am not lying), a teacher of the Gentiles in faith and truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I desire then that in every place the men should pray, lifting holy hands without anger or quarrelling;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: likewise also that women should adorn themselves in respectable apparel, with modesty and self-control, not with braided hair and gold or pearls or costly attire,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but with what is proper for women who profess godliness—with good works.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let a woman learn quietly with all submissiveness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I do not permit a woman to teach or to exercise authority over a man; rather, she is to remain quiet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Adam was formed first, then Eve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Adam was not deceived, but the woman was deceived and became a transgressor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet she will be saved through childbearing—if they continue in faith and love and holiness, with self-control.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The saying is trustworthy: If anyone aspires to the office of overseer, he desires a noble task.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore an overseer must be above reproach, the husband of one wife, sober-minded, self-controlled, respectable, hospitable, able to teach,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not a drunkard, not violent but gentle, not quarrelsome, not a lover of money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He must manage his own household well, with all dignity keeping his children submissive,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for if someone does not know how to manage his own household, how will he care for God's church?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He must not be a recent convert, or he may become puffed up with conceit and fall into the condemnation of the devil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, he must be well thought of by outsiders, so that he may not fall into disgrace, into a snare of the devil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Deacons likewise must be dignified, not double-tongued, not addicted to much wine, not greedy for dishonest gain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They must hold the mystery of the faith with a clear conscience.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And let them also be tested first; then let them serve as deacons if they prove themselves blameless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their wives likewise must be dignified, not slanderers, but sober-minded, faithful in all things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let deacons each be the husband of one wife, managing their children and their own households well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For those who serve well as deacons gain a good standing for themselves and also great confidence in the faith that is in Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I hope to come to you soon, but I am writing these things to you so that,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if I delay, you may know how one ought to behave in the household of God, which is the church of the living God, a pillar and buttress of the truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Great indeed, we confess, is the mystery of godliness:
He was manifested in the flesh,
    vindicated by the Spirit,
        seen by angels,
proclaimed among the nations,
    believed on in the world,
        taken up in glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Spirit expressly says that in later times some will depart from the faith by devoting themselves to deceitful spirits and teachings of demons,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: through the insincerity of liars whose consciences are seared,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who forbid marriage and require abstinence from foods that God created to be received with thanksgiving by those who believe and know the truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For everything created by God is good, and nothing is to be rejected if it is received with thanksgiving,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for it is made holy by the word of God and prayer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you put these things before the brothers, you will be a good servant of Christ Jesus, being trained in the words of the faith and of the good doctrine that you have followed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have nothing to do with irreverent, silly myths. Rather train yourself for godliness;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for while bodily training is of some value, godliness is of value in every way, as it holds promise for the present life and also for the life to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The saying is trustworthy and deserving of full acceptance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For to this end we toil and strive, because we have our hope set on the living God, who is the Saviour of all people, especially of those who believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Command and teach these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let no one despise you for your youth, but set the believers an example in speech, in conduct, in love, in faith, in purity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Until I come, devote yourself to the public reading of Scripture, to exhortation, to teaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not neglect the gift you have, which was given you by prophecy when the council of elders laid their hands on you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Practise these things, immerse yourself in them, so that all may see your progress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Keep a close watch on yourself and on the teaching. Persist in this, for by so doing you will save both yourself and your hearers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not rebuke an older man but encourage him as you would a father, younger men as brothers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: older women as mothers, younger women as sisters, in all purity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Honour widows who are truly widows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if a widow has children or grandchildren, let them first learn to show godliness to their own household and to make some return to their parents, for this is pleasing in the sight of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She who is truly a widow, left all alone, has set her hope on God and continues in supplications and prayers night and day,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but she who is self-indulgent is dead even while she lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Command these things as well, so that they may be without reproach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if anyone does not provide for his relatives, and especially for members of his household, he has denied the faith and is worse than an unbeliever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let a widow be enrolled if she is not less than sixty years of age, having been the wife of one husband,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having a reputation for good works: if she has brought up children, has shown hospitality, has washed the feet of the saints, has cared for the afflicted, and has devoted herself to every good work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But refuse to enrol younger widows, for when their passions draw them away from Christ, they desire to marry
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and so incur condemnation for having abandoned their former faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Besides that, they learn to be idlers, going about from house to house, and not only idlers, but also gossips and busybodies, saying what they should not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I would have younger widows marry, bear children, manage their households, and give the adversary no occasion for slander.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For some have already strayed after Satan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If any believing woman has relatives who are widows, let her care for them. Let the church not be burdened, so that it may care for those who are truly widows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let the elders who rule well be considered worthy of double honour, especially those who labour in preaching and teaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Scripture says, “You shall not muzzle an ox when it treads out the grain”, and, “The labourer deserves his wages.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not admit a charge against an elder except on the evidence of two or three witnesses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for those who persist in sin, rebuke them in the presence of all, so that the rest may stand in fear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the presence of God and of Christ Jesus and of the elect angels I charge you to keep these rules without prejudging, doing nothing from partiality.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not be hasty in the laying on of hands, nor take part in the sins of others; keep yourself pure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (No longer drink only water, but use a little wine for the sake of your stomach and your frequent ailments.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sins of some men are conspicuous, going before them to judgement, but the sins of others appear later.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So also good works are conspicuous, and even those that are not cannot remain hidden.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let all who are under a yoke as slaves regard their own masters as worthy of all honour, so that the name of God and the teaching may not be reviled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who have believing masters must not be disrespectful on the ground that they are brothers; rather they must serve all the better since those who benefit by their good service are believers and beloved.
Teach and urge these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone teaches a different doctrine and does not agree with the sound words of our Lord Jesus Christ and the teaching that accords with godliness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he is puffed up with conceit and understands nothing. He has an unhealthy craving for controversy and for quarrels about words, which produce envy, dissension, slander, evil suspicions,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and constant friction among people who are depraved in mind and deprived of the truth, imagining that godliness is a means of gain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there is great gain in godliness with contentment,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for we brought nothing into the world, and we cannot take anything out of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if we have food and clothing, with these we will be content.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But those who desire to be rich fall into temptation, into a snare, into many senseless and harmful desires that plunge people into ruin and destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the love of money is a root of all kinds of evils. It is through this craving that some have wandered away from the faith and pierced themselves with many pangs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for you, O man of God, flee these things. Pursue righteousness, godliness, faith, love, steadfastness, gentleness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fight the good fight of the faith. Take hold of the eternal life to which you were called and about which you made the good confession in the presence of many witnesses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I charge you in the presence of God, who gives life to all things, and of Christ Jesus, who in his testimony before Pontius Pilate made the good confession,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to keep the commandment unstained and free from reproach until the appearing of our Lord Jesus Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which he will display at the proper time—he who is the blessed and only Sovereign, the King of kings and Lord of lords,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who alone has immortality, who dwells in unapproachable light, whom no one has ever seen or can see. To him be honour and eternal dominion. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the rich in this present age, charge them not to be haughty, nor to set their hopes on the uncertainty of riches, but on God, who richly provides us with everything to enjoy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are to do good, to be rich in good works, to be generous and ready to share,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: thus storing up treasure for themselves as a good foundation for the future, so that they may take hold of that which is truly life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O Timothy, guard the deposit entrusted to you. Avoid the irreverent babble and contradictions of what is falsely called “knowledge”,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for by professing it some have swerved from the faith.
Grace be with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
